content.description: Snot Easy is a variation to The Nose Arrow. Start to the right of a weird root sticking out of the crack to the right of the big, juggy crack of The Nose Cracks. Traverse left on good holds, then downclimb a few moves of The Booger, and reach down into the start holds of The Nose Arrow. Then finish up on The Nose Arrow. Don’t punt.
content.location: Start on a good jug ledge right of a twisted root that is to the right of The Nose Cracks (which is to the right of The Booger).

content.description: Both sides of the Nose prow have a big, rough, layback crack. Both are pretty chill. The left crux is moving around the tree in the crack.

This is THE  line on the Nose Boulder. Start sitting on jugs down and left of nose, move up left hand to good hold, then go to a crimp/slot under the nose. Go left to a funky hold on the right side of the arête, and then balance out from under the nose using the slab for feet to a sloper over the roof. Use more slopers to move up and then right to the giant crack (as high up as you possibly can, i.e. no cheating and moving right to the crack). Once you have the crack, the topout is easy.
Traverse low from R->L starting as far right as possible (right of the crack). A reverse is possible. There is potential for a high traverse, maybe a different day.
The crux is either getting from the ledge to the face or the top section.
content.location: Sit start low on jugs to the right of Bread & Butter, then traverse right on jugs for a bit, and ascend up the mossy face on edges and sidepull crimps. Then top out.Note: the jug flake on the right is off.

content.description: This is a straightforward, easy face climb. Start low.
content.location: If you're desperate for another warmup, this is the face just left of Nose Hairs. Push the pine tree branches out of the way to get on the start.

content.description: Start with your right on a decent hold, your left on a sloper, and a high step. Go straight up.
content.location: It is left of Canadian Bridge.

content.description: Start as low as possible, go straight up, and top out in the V-shaped split. OR go out right for some X-rated fun.
content.location: It is on the opposite side of the nose, in the dihedral/crack just left of the chimney.

content.description: Start with your left on a small, knobby undercling below waist level and your right on a good hold. Smear right foot, and rock up onto slab. DO NOT USE THE ARETE AT ALL!
content.location: It is just left of Bread & Butter.

content.description: Start on good holds just left of chimney, pull into the sharp flake/arete and lay back to the top.
content.location: This is on the backside of the Nose Boulder. Climb the small, detached part standing about 10 feet high.

content.description: This is the eliminate problem that avoids the good jug flake to the right until near the top.  Start sitting at crimp slot on prow, move up to good solid jug pinch.  Make big move to the left to get sloper up high, then chuck right hand to good flake and easy topout.
This is the largest boulder in the Trees, distinguished by a blunt nose problem, with nice layback crack problems on both sides.
